chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Justice R Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Justice R Olson
Current: 1524 Greencrest Dr, Watertown, WI 53098 United States  (Effective: 07-17-2018)
Prior: 112 E. Elm St., De Forest, WI 53532 United States

The Court orders that: Upon deposit of $100.00 and current address information, the Defendant be released from custody on the above mentioned case.  The Defendant shall pay the remaining balance plus interest and $15.00 payment plan fee at the rate of $50.00/month commencing 08/15/2018.  25% annual increase of monthly payments shall be implemented.  Civil judgment and referral to the WI DOR if applicable shall remain.  Any failure to comply with this payment order shall result in the re-imposition of the failure to pay sentence without further notice of hearing.  Other - 17CF280 and 13CF453 shall be added to payment plan, upon payment of deposit, if not at collections.

records.addlTxt: Per Court order

[MK] cases #17CF280 and #14CF416 called at 8:20am. 
Defendant Justice R Olson in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
As to Case #17CF280: the Court schedules the case for Preliminary Hearing. 
As to Case #14CF416:  after Ms. Olson provides information on her newly-acquired employment, the Court vacates the Warrant [Commitment Order] and the Court allows a payment plan of $50 per month commencing on 11/1/17 and on the first day of each month thereafter until paid in full [the alternate sentence remains as 20 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.] 
recess 8:25am.

from Defendant requesting early release

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:04 am [sf]
Defendant Justice R Olson in court, in custody with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court has reviewed 4 letters of support of the Defendant filed by Attorney Zarwell.
ADA Hall advises that she has reviewed the revocation paperwork from DOC and has no corrections.
Attorney Zarwell advises that he has 2 corrections to make to the revocation, page 2 should read 14CF416 instead of 13CF184.
Court will correct it's copy to reflect correct case number.
Attorney Zarwell has a factual correction to page 2 of the revocation summary paragraph 3, that the defendant's counselor left and that she ran out of medication.
ADA presents sentencing recommendation.
Attorney Zarwell presents sentencing argument.


On Count #1 the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 1 year in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for purposes of  counseling or treatment at Human services or some other counseling facility and employment
--119 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay outstanding costs; due in $50 increments per month beginning 4/30/17 and on the last day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 20 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive.

Felony Firearm/Voting Restrictions Warnings Given
Recess:9:37 am
Letter from Attorney Zarwell enclosing letters on behalf of the Defendant
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Attorney David Zarwell
DOC Balance Inquiry
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Revocation Order and Warrant received from DOC
The Court orders the Judgment of Conviction be amended to reflect that Count #3 is 1 year probation.
Letter from DOC requesting clarification

records.addlTxt: with elements and criminal case settlement

Case called at 2:05pm [mo]
Defendant Justice R Olson in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of "Guilty" entered on Counts #1 and #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 and 4.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Ms. Olson

On Counts #1 and #3, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 30 months, with conditions:

--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety, to include no precense in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to submit DNA sample upon demand by designee
--take all medications as prescribed
--Ms. Olson is to write a letter of apology to the Police Officer she injured and submit to Probation Agent by June 30, 2015
--On Count #1 to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--On Count #3 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

The Court does not authorize expungement of this case
Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 2:27pm

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:46am [MK]
Defendant Justice R Olson in court, in custody, with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Both counsel acknowledge receipt of Dr. Smith's Report, and indicate that they are in agreement with Dr. Smith's findings that Ms. Olson is currently incompetent. 
In response to the Court's inquiry of Ms. Olson individually, Ms. Olson indicates that she believes that she is currently incompentent. 
The Court finds that Ms. Olson is currently incompetent to proceed however she is likely to become competent if provided with appropriate medication and treatment.
The Court suspends the proceedings. 
The Court commits Ms. Olson, giving her 77 days credit for time served.

The Court raises that it has received communication from an Administrative Law Judge making inquiry about how the competency procedings in this case impact the pending probation revocation proceeding is case #13CF453. 
The State does not object to this document being shared with the individuals that are within the legal system. 
The Court orders that the Probation Revocation proceedings in Case #13CF453 are also suspended, pending restoration of competence.
The Court finds Ms. Olson incompetent for purposes of the revocation proceedings Case #13CF453.   The Court directs the clerk to send a copy of the incompetency order to Administrative Law Judge Rebecca Bahle and to Agent Jon Olzewski.  
Recess: 9:55am
Branch 1 has no objection
Courts response: Branch 4 is willing to grant this request on the condition that the court assigned to case #13CF453 (Branch 1) does not object
Letter from the Division of Hearings and Appeals requesting competency determination
Competency hearing on February 12, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Order for Competency Exam
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 1:15 pm [Clerk SH] 
Defendant Justice R Olson appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. Public Service, Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews probable cause statement 
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that Ms. Justice does qualify for SPD Services

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Court finds probable cause within the complaint to support Counts #1 - #4
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties; Court does not take pleas on misdemeanor charges

Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No acts or threats of violence
-Take all prescription drugs as prescribed
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty De La Rosa requests that instead of STC, the matter be set for preliminary hearing after DA PTC as there may be NGI plea in this case
